Example

Solve for \(x\) if \(3\ln x+4\log_{10} x=1\).

Solution

This has logs to two different bases. So we must first express each logarithm in terms of logs to the same base, \(e\) say Recall

\[\log_{10} x=\dfrac{\ln x}{\ln 10}.\] So \(3\ln x+4\log x=1\) becomes \[ 3\ln x+4\dfrac{\ln x}{\ln 10}=1\qquad\text{or}\qquad \left(3+\dfrac{4}{\ln 10}\right)\ln x=1\] leading to \(\ln x=\dfrac{\ln 10}{3\ln 10 +4}=\dfrac{2.302585}{10.907755}=0.211096\) and so \[ x=e^{0.211096}=1.2350311.\]
